title: Jack Savoretti takes us on a guided tour of his new musical genre, Europiana
description: The star says he's created a new style of music on his seventh album. Find out what that means...

title: A billion new trees might not turn Ukraine green
description: The country's ambitious target to improve the environment could actually harm biodiversity.

title: China's changes through one man's lens
description: Yan Zhigang has spent four decades photographing the streets, and the people, of China.

title: ‘It all could have ended for me that day'
description: Sean O'Hare suffered a double stroke, but 10 months on he regularly hikes in the Mournes.

title: Outcry over South Africa's multiple husbands proposal
description: Critics say it would be "un-African" for a woman to have more than one husband at the same time.

title: The LGBT people forced 'back in the closet' when they enter residential care
description: Rita spent her final years in sheltered accommodation where she felt forced to keep her sexuality secret.

title: Aimee Fuller: Olympian tests 'flying surfboard' on Thames
description: Olympic snowboarder Aimee Fuller takes an electric surfboard for a spin on the River Thames.

title: Matt Hancock: Did ex-health secretary break the law?
description: Matt Hancock resigns for breaching social distancing guidelines after photos emerged of him and a colleague embracing.

title: Miami building collapse: Fearful relatives hunt news of missing
description: Details emerge of the scores unaccounted for in the Florida building collapse.

title: Sydenham stabbing: Murder probe into 19-year-old's death
description: The victim's mother has visited the scene in south-east London where her son was killed, police say.

title: ICYMI: Spider-Man meets the Pope
description: A nuisance bear, overheated otters and a special guest for the Pope, some of the stories you may have missed this week.

title: Matt Hancock: Calls for health secretary to quit after kissing colleague
description: The first fellow Tory MP says he should go after being pictured in a clinch with Gina Coladangelo.

title: London protests: Police arrest 12 ahead of weekend demonstrations
description: Protests are taking place across London including anti-lockdown and climate change demonstrations.

title: Covid vaccine: Novavax trial volunteer's holiday in jeopardy
description: Tom Williams says he has been refused an approved jab after taking part in the Novavax vaccine.

title: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson endorsed as DUP leader
description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson is the only candidate to put his name forward for the party leadership.

title: Hairdressers fear staff crisis after apprentice shortage
description: The pandemic caused the already decreasing number of apprentices to fall further, hairdressers say.

title: Qatari 400m runner Haroun killed in crash
description: Qatari sprinter Abdalelah Haroun, who won bronze in the 400m at the 2017 World Championships, dies in a car crash aged 24.

title: Covid: Australia extends Sydney lockdown as Delta outbreak grows
description: Australia's biggest city and surrounding areas enter a two-week lockdown following a jump in cases.

title: How a patient treated 280 miles from home died on the M11 hard shoulder
description: Peggy Copeman, 81, was neglected by a private ambulance service, a coroner concludes.

title: Sea shanty singer's rise from postie to popstar 'kind of thing you dream of'
description: Nathan Evans talks to BBC Scotland's The Edit about playing the Brits and being on the bill at TRNSMT.

title: Glasgow MP moved to safe house after death threat
description: Carol Monaghan wants better protection for public figures after online abuse became a real threat.

title: Euro 2020: Select your combined England and Germany starting XI
description: As England and Germany prepare to meet in the last 16 of Euro 2020, we are asking you to create your combined XI.

title: Covid-19: 'Grab a jab' for all over-18s opens in England
description: Any adult will be able to get a vaccine without an appointment this weekend at hundreds of walk-in sites.

title: The Papers: Hancock hangs on - but will it be 'Barnard Castle moment?'
description: Saturday's papers are dominated by the pictures and fallout of the health secretary kissing an aide.

title: Miami building collapse: Demands for answers grow
description: Governor Ron DeSantis says families "have a right to know" how a 12-storey building collapsed.

title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.

title: Infected blood: Parents and pupils reveal they were kept in dark at stricken school
description: In a week of harrowing testimony, ex-pupils described how 72 friends died of Aids and hepatitis.

title: E10 petrol: What is it and can my car run it?
description: A more eco-friendly petrol is coming to filling stations in the UK - but it's not suitable for all cars.

title: 'Working from home has helped me keep a full-time job'
description: People reveal how technology has helped or hindered them during the pandemic, using #MyAccessiblePandemic.

title: 'We got justice, but not enough justice'
description: People in Minneapolis reacted to the sentencing of Derek Chauvin on Friday.

title: William Blake: Biography offers glimpse into artist and poet's visionary mind
description: A new book, and fresh medical studies, seem to re-frame the artist and poet's famous visions.
